oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIMENTAL STUDY OF BREAKING WAVES OVER A SHOAL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chawla, Arun
Ozkan-Haller, H. Tuba
Kirby, James T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breaking waves
shoal
experimental study
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this paper is to study the transformation of irregular directional waves over a circular shoal. An experimental study has been carried out. The resulting data has been used to test the accuracy of an existing refraction-diffraction model. Model to data comparisons have been carried out for the entire basin region including about 3 shoal diameters downwave of the shoal, with satisfactory results. Several physical processes have been identified which lead to possible disparities in the comparisons.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
